message.content:
cs.SC, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LO, cs.GT. 

This paper deals with the problem of finding denominator bounds for solutions of recurrence equations, which is a topic that falls under the scope of symbolic computation (cs.SC) and computational complexity (cs.CC). The use of $\Pi\Sigma$-extensions is a technique that is commonly used in the study of difference equations and recurrence relations, which suggests that the paper could also be classified under the sub-category of discrete mathematics (cs.DS). The paper also involves the use of nested sums and products, which are common in the study of combinatorics and graph theory, indicating that the paper could also be classified under the sub-categories of combinatorics (cs.CO) and graph theory (cs.GT). Finally, the paper involves the study of polynomial solutions, which is a topic that falls under the scope of logic in computer science (cs.LO).
